message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC 

This paper deals with the problem of estimating perceptual error between images, which is a core problem in computer vision. The paper proposes a new learning-based method that predicts perceptual image error like human observers. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses a deep-learning model and a pairwise-learning framework, which suggests that it may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.MM) and Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of a large-scale dataset and the difficulty of creating such datasets, which suggests that it may belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the human perception of image quality, which suggests that it may also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category.
